description: On April 16th, Andorra, has adopted a unique way of easing lockdown restrictions. Those who live in even-numbered homes are allowed to go out on even dates, while those who reside in odd-numbered homes on all other days. Houses without a number will go out on even dates if the name of occupants begins with A-M, and odd days if it starts with N-Z. Running or walking fast can take place between 6 am and 9 am or from 6 pm to 9 pm. Andorrans can shop or stroll between 9 am and 11 am or between 2 pm and 7 pm. The time between 11 am and 2 pm is reserved for vulnerable and elderly populations to get out of the house.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On April 16th, Andorra, has adopted a unique way of easing lockdown restrictions. Those who live in even-numbered homes are allowed to go out on even dates, while those who reside in odd-numbered homes on all other days. Houses without a number will go out on even dates if the name of occupants begins with A-M, and odd days if it starts with N-Z. Running or walking fast can take place between 6 am and 9 am or from 6 pm to 9 pm. Andorrans can shop or stroll between 9 am and 11 am or between 2 pm and 7 pm. The time between 11 am and 2 pm is reserved for vulnerable and elderly populations to get out of the house.
 UPDATE: The Government still requires people to stay at home but measures have been relaxed. People are allowed to go walking, running and to carry out sports activities in the mountains, such as hiking, running or fishing. They can choose between going out one hour every day or two hours on alternate days depending on the building numbers. Cycling as a means of transport is permitted.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 11 March, the Andorran Government declares a "sanitary emergency" in the country.

On 11 March, the Andorran Government declares a "sanitary emergency" in the country. UPDATE: Spokesman Eric Jover said in an appearance on Wednesday evening that the Executive had extended the exceptional measures due to the health emergency caused by the new SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus with no expiration date. Thus, the actions will be maintained until the Government agrees to leave them without effect.
Andorra government declares the law of exceptional and urgent measures for the health emergency situation caused by the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, better known as the omnibus law,

"Andorra government establishes criteria for the application of a temporary restriction on non-essential trips from third countries to the European Union and Schengen associated countries for reasons of public order and health, due to the health crisis caused by COVID-19".
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 11, 2020, Andorra's Minister of Social Affairs, Housing and Youth, Víctor Filloy, together with the Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, chaired the second meeting of the Sociosanitary Monitoring Commission (COSS) this Friday morning. The meeting allowed to decide, in a joint and coordinated way between the participants, the extension of the security measures in the Sociosanitary Centers of the country. Among the new decisions used, the extension of COVID-19 detection tests among the workers of the centers will be carried out from now on every fortnight.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On Monday, April 6, 2020. Andorra's Minister Jover has reported the arrival in the country of medical equipment from France and China. the Hospital Nostra Senyora de Meritxell has been included as another hospital within the Groupement Hospitalier de Territoire des Pyrénnées Ariégeoises. This allows Andorra to supply itself according to its needs. In this first consignment, which has been collected in Foix, has allowed the arrival of 3,800 FFP2 masks and 16,350 surgical masks.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On June 29th 2020 in Andorra, the Municipality of Canillo approves an extraordinary credit for the communal aid program for the health emergency situation caused by the SARS-Cov-2 pandemic.

description:
The Government hires a company for the telephone reservation service for the tests of the Covid-19.

Since this week, Espic has been in charge of carrying out the telephone helpline for those who want to make an appointment for coronavirus diagnostic tests .

For this task, the company will receive an amount of 20,500 euros, according to the BOPA . The deadline for the execution of these works is set between 21 August and 20 November and is renewable with the agreement of the Government for periods of one month up to a maximum of twelve months.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 16th 2020, The Andorran Government has approved, at the proposal of the Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, the formalization of the contract for the acquisition of vaccines against COVID-19 through the COVAX Facility mechanism led by the international organization GAVI.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In two weeks from April 6th 2020, Andorra will launch the first phase of deconfinement of the population through tests which will concern all the inhabitants of the Principality. By testing its entire population, Andorra will seek to determine the level of coronavirus infection in the Principality. For this, Andorra will carry out rapid tests which will make it possible to determine whether the subject has developed antibodies to fight against the Covid-19 coronavirus. Depending on the evolution of the coronavirus in the Principality, Andorra will then initiate the second phase of deconfinement. with the gradual opening up of personal services and economic activities.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Andorra's health authorities will screen the children and monitors of the Escaldes-Engordany Summer Sports. The health authorities have detected a total of 7 positives, 5 from the same cohabiting unit and 2 related, in the Summer Sports of the parish of Escaldes-Engordany. The epidemiological survey and traceability are currently being carried out and an operation is being coordinated, together with the municipality of Escaldes-Engordany, to screen all children and monitors of summer sports.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Andorra's  Minister of Health reports on the exceptional measures to deal with the infection with the new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) relating to the recommendations for playgrounds.These recommendations are established to minimize the risk of transmission of SARS-CoV-2 infection in these spaces. Specifically:
- It is recommended that users of these equipments carry out hand hygiene before and after using them, or use hydroalcoholic gel.
- The use of a mask is recommended, depending on the instructions of the health authorities.
- It is necessary to avoid that agglomerations in these equipments occur.- It is necessary to guarantee the frequent cleaning of the facilities.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 3rd 2020, Andorra's Ministry of Social Affairs, Housing and Youth has today delivered 1,000 devices to open doors, made of 3D printed polylactic acid material and provided to the Ministry part of the Department of Mobility, the Federation of the Elderly of Andorra . The purpose of these devices is to prevent the person using them from touching doors, elevator buttons or other public elements that could lead to a risk of SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infection.

description: On March 22 2020, Andorra's government and Minister of Spokesperson Eric Jover explained in the press conference that, given the exceptional situation arising from the health crisis, which has led to the application of restrictions on the mobility of people, the use of national transport lines has been reduced. Thus, the internal lines will be reduced to one vehicle every hour in the morning, noon and night strips.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On Friday, March 13 2020, Andorra's government made a special announcement regarding exceptional measures being taken to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. From tomorrow Saturday and for an extendable period of up to 15 days it is decreed the closure of all leisure establishments, and all commercial establishments, with the exception of those that sell basic necessities. All those formalities or actions that are not urgent will have to be postponed until the end of these measures.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On Friday, March 13 2020, Andorra's government made a special announcement regarding exceptional measures being taken to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. From tomorrow Saturday and for an extendable period of up to 15 days it is decreed the closure of all leisure establishments, and all commercial establishments, with the exception of those that sell basic necessities. All those formalities or actions that are not urgent will have to be postponed until the end of these measures. UPDATE: In today's press conference, the head of government, Xavier Espot and the head of health, Joan Martínez Benazet, presented the second phase of exceptions to confinement, which extend the ones in force since April 16, and which will be applicable from Wednesday 13 May. In this sense, in terms of the maximum distance from home to exercise or walk, until now it was two kilometers and from Wednesday the limitation on the route of travel is completely removed.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 11 March, the Andorran Government creates a technical committee with the purpose of monitoring, evaluating and adapting preventive measures on a daily basis. This policy is part of the first exceptional health measures.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Wednesday, July 22, 2020, The Andorran Government approved this Wednesday, at the proposal of the Minister of Social Affairs, Housing and Youth, Víctor Filloy, the Regulations for the creation of the Commission for Social and Health Monitoring (COSS) and the functions of the COSS include the definition and elaboration of proposals for action and management of the centers to prevent and mitigate the effects of SARS-CoV-2, both in terms of to the resident population, the visits, the sanitary and socio-sanitary personnel, as well as any person who transits through the socio-sanitary centers.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Wednesday, March 4, 2020, The economic benefits of temporary disability in Coronavirus isolation situations are approved

The Andorran Government, at the proposal of the Minister of Health, Joan Martinez Benazet, has approved the Decree of the Regulation of the economic benefits of temporary disability in situations of isolation of people in the face of the international public health emergency situation by coronavirus.

Thus, all those people who are under observation, either at home due to the risk of exposure to the virus, or hospitalized with suspicion of this condition, will receive the CASS sickness benefit and thus will have their medical leave covered.
type_text: Economic policy providing benefits to those in isolation due to Covid
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 18th 2020, The Andorran Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people starting Monday 9/21. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols.

description: On September 18th 2020, The Andorran Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people starting Monday 9/21. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols. description: On October 7th 2020, Andorra's Council of Ministers approved this Wednesday the application of new exceptional measures to deal with the health situation caused by COVID-19. The aim of the new decisions is to help curb the rate of reproduction of the pandemic.  The use of the mask is maintained for all extracurricular activities and playgrounds remain closed. With regard to restaurants, the maximum number of five people per table is maintained and they must be separated by the stipulated minimum distances. The commercial premises is limited to 1 person for every 4m.
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Other (Please specify in the text box)
